page.title: 02A Father's Day in Creeting
page.content: I came to Creeting St. Mary ten years ago with the move of British Telecom from London to Martlesham Heath. My day starts at 06.40 with a walk across the fields with the dog or sometimes a jog down the quiet back lane if the weather's fine. I breakfast with my wife, the two children, Casper the dog, Domino the kitten and Radio 4 and at 8 o'clock I share the 3O minute drive to Martlesham with a fellow BT worker. My work at BT involves the design of new office communication systems. I return home before 6 p.m. for a family tea and then into the garden or off to play badminton. Alternatively I put the children to bed whilst my wife goes to Keep Fit, PTA or WI. We switch the light out nearer to 12 than 11.
